column2:
noun
  1. Egypt (a country in North Africa and Western Asia)

name
  1. the nickname of the Armenian medieval ashugh Nahapet Kuchak

noun
  1. aromatic shell shards that look like fingernails, taken from shell sea-creatures; onycha

noun
  1. a kind of buckthorn berry that is used as a yellow dye

noun
  1. alyssum (Alyssum; according to Vardanjan, specifically Alyssum saxatile)

adj
  1. half-witted, apish, trifling, silly, that plays the fool
  2. (nominalized) ninny, simpleton

noun
  1. groin (the fold or depression on either side of the body between the abdomen and the upper thigh)

verb
  1. (transitive) to rub, to mix, to knead

adj
  1. (of vine) rooted, taken root
  2. noble, pure, true-born

noun
  1. superfluous branches cut off from a vine and used for kindling

noun
  1. shank (meat from the leg of an animal)

noun
  1. arm, forearm (of humans and animals)
  2. (figuratively) stalks and other arm-like parts of various plants
  3. chard, beet, beetroot

noun
  1. some Artemisia spp., such as Artemisia abrotanum and Artemisia vulgaris

noun
  1. bastard, illegitimate child
  2. sucker (an undesired stem growing out of the roots or lower trunk of a plant)

noun
  1. hackberry, the fruit of the nettle tree (Celtis spp.)

noun
  1. rice (plant)
  2. rice (seeds of the plant used as food)

noun
  1. a certain tool for making holes, trepan, auger, borer, gimlet

noun
  1. frog
  2. the roundish part of the hoof
  3. swelling or fold under the tongue

noun
  1. large stone water vessel as a bath or trough
  2. kneading trough

noun
  1. damson, damson plum, Prunus insititia (tree)
  2. damson, damson plum (fruit)

noun
  1. mill hopper (a funnel-shaped container, whence the grist is discharged into the mill)

noun
  1. kind of bread
  2. (transferred sense) an architectural ornament/detail, probably architrave

noun
  1. the projecting part of the head, including the nose, mouth and jaws

noun
  1. king
  2. bridegroom (because he carries a crown during the wedding)

noun
  1. roosting perch
  2. a bar from which fruits (e.g. grapes) are hung to dry

verb
  1. to perch, to roost, to go to roost

noun
  1. a kind of bird that feeds on figs

noun
  1. a kind of fruit, perhaps gooseberry or raspberry

noun
  1. Lebanese buckthorn, Rhamnus libanotica or raspberry, Rubus idaeus

noun
  1. camomile (Matricaria gen., Anthemis gen. and Chamaemelum gen.)

noun
  1. germander, Teucrium; wall germander, Teucrium chamaedrys; Teucrium multicaule

noun
  1. bit (piece of metal placed in a horse's mouth and connected to the reins to direct the animal)

noun
  1. amaranth (any of the plants in the family Amaranthaceae)

noun
  1. a kind of fly that bites donkeys and cattle

verb
  1. (intransitive) to eat one's fill; to be full (after eating)

noun
  1. found only in Baṙgirkʿ hayocʿ, glossed as “խոնարհք կամ կնիք (xonarhkʿ kam knikʿ)”

verb
  1. to croak (said of birds, particularly crows, as well as of frogs, snakes, buffalos, etc.)

noun
  1. a type of disease that causes red skin rash, perhaps the measles

noun
  1. maidenhair fern (Adiantum) or, more specifically, southern maidenhair fern, black maidenhair fern, Venus hair fern (Adiantum capillus-veneris); but according to others blue fleabane (Erigeron acris)

noun
  1. boiled and crushed wheat, barley or spelt

noun
  1. watermelon (plant and fruit) (Citrullus lanatus, syn. Citrullus vulgaris)

noun
  1. plane tree, Platanus
  2. bead tree, Persian lilac, Melia azedarach

noun
  1. a kind of plant, usually identified with caraway, Carum carvi

noun
  1. property, possession
  2. cattle, livestock
  3. a kind of tax levied on cattle

noun
  1. the designation of various natural gums and resins, in particular the resin of Ferula galbaniflua (syn. gummosa, galbanum), Ferula assa-foetida (asafoetida), and the մարխ (marx) tree

noun
  1. dog rose, Rosa canina (the plant and especially its fruit – the rosehip)

noun
  1. a high and hard piece of ground

noun
  1. a measure of grain or liquid, equal to ¹⁄₁₀ մոդ (mod)

noun
  1. a kind of a resinous conifer, perhaps Pinus pinea or Pinus cembra
  2. the resinous wood of this tree that ignites easily

noun
  1. blackberry, dewberry, bramble, Rubus gen. et spp. (berry and shrub)

noun
  1. blackberry, dewberry, bramble, Rubus gen. et spp. (shrub)

noun
  1. blackberry, dewberry, bramble, Rubus gen. et spp. (shrub)

noun
  1. nightshade, hound's berry, or the like
  2. blackberry
  3. strawberry
  4. a kind of poisonous spider, probably wolf spider, tarantula, Lycosa

adj
  1. known, evident, clear, visible

adv
  1. evidently, obviously, plainly, clearly, manifestly

noun
  1. bottom (e.g. of a sea, stomach, etc.)
  2. land, country
  3. homeland

verb
  1. to shoot an arrow
  2. (by extension) to throw (any object)

noun
  1. a kind of large cucumber or melon

noun
  1. a plant whose root produces a resinous gum: laserwort, Laserpitium or Ferula assa-foetida; and its resinous gum, respectively: laser or asafoetida or galbanum or opopanax

noun
  1. chortan (a kind of curds in the form of dried balls made from tan)

noun
  1. eggplant, aubergine (Solanum melongena)
  2. eggplant, aubergine (fruit of Solanum melongena)

noun
  1. paron, baron (a title of nobility in the Armenian Kingdom of Cilicia)
  2. mister, sir (form of address)

noun
  1. a kind of small bird
  2. (music) a kind of melody

noun
  1. red sulphide of arsenic: sandarac, realgar or red orpiment

noun
  1. a kind of large headwear worn by an աբեղա (abeła) under a վեղար (vełar)

noun
  1. seneschal (tite in the Armenian Kingdom of Cilicia)

noun
  1. a kind of anadromous fish, probably a kind of salmon, perhaps the Salmo ciscaucasicus or Salmo caspius

noun
  1. tarek, pearl mullet, Van fish, Alburnus tarichi (especially in a dried and salted form)

noun
  1. pine, Pinus, perhaps specifically stone pine, Pinus pinea

verb
  1. (of animals) to rummage, dig (in search of food)

noun
  1. young of a horse or a donkey, colt, foal
